intro: Pectis burchellii, commonly known as the Burchell's pectis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, with hairy, branching stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its yellow flowers are arranged in dense, spherical clusters, and it produces small, ribbed fruits known as cypselae. Pectis burchellii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
